content: top of the nose by sewing the corners of the top of the nose a little lower than the middle to make it stick out sew the edges of the nose to the edges of the center hole ⓒ 2023 katy s crafting corner | kathryn nelson | all rights reserved eyes sew the eyes on either side of the nose using the white tail you will sew through each stitch on the white round of the eye i sewed mine on so the baggy part of the eye was slightly lined up with the top of the nose eyebrows as shown in the notes you can add eyebrows either way i added six to seven 4 strands to each eye and separated the yarn to make it look more fluffy ears i sewed the ears about 6-7 stitches from the bottom in between the 3rd and 5th row of the side panel of the cover optional you can add some hair in the ears by tying them to the half_double_crochet in the side panel i was able to put six 4 strands of gray yarn in each ear after i separated the yarn i cut it down to where i wanted it ⓒ 2023 katy s crafting corner | kathryn nelson | all rights reserved back panel line up the back panel to the side panels making sure the corners are at the top whip stitch along the edges skipping over the chain-space s on both corners just like we did on the front panel see picture b in the notes section hair find the corner of the front panel and find a corresponding st on the side panel i placed a 5 and a 6 strand in each st across i triple knotted each strand and then separated them for that fluffy look ⓒ 2023 katy s crafting corner | kathryn nelson | all rights reserved
